step_1.title: Cleanse
step_1.description:
No reason to wash your face in the morning even if you use a retinol at night, UNLESS you get super greasy overnight or work out in the am. But if you want to start clean, any gentle non-stripping cleanser works.

If you wear make up, sometimes a gentle exfoliant is good in the am to smooth your palette. I love this chemical exfoliant by Tatcha since it has a small amount of grit to make you feel clean.

Fun fact: Many people use cleansers with chemical exfoliants wrong, work it in on a damp face and let it sit for a minute or two. Then gently start to massage in while rinsing. I used to think expensive cleansers were a scam until I realized this.

step_2.title: Tone
step_2.description: Swipe your face with a cotton pad and toner if you wash your face in the am. I like micellar water or Thayers non-alcoholic toner. No need to if you did not cleanse, skip to step 3.

step_3.title: Mist
step_3.description: Products penetrate better on moist skin plus, it feels so luxurious. Obviously optional but there are a lot of benefits of rose water.

step_4.title: Serum
step_4.description:
The copper peptide serum is great to use with the NuFace, but you can use any water-based serum. The NuFace will help anything you put on at this step penetrate deeper, do not use any AHAs or oil-based serums as it will block the microcurrent.

If you won't be using the NuFace, this is a good time to use a vitamin C serum. Then skip to Step 7.

step_5.title: NuFace Gel
step_5.description:
Nuface reformulated this gel with their new line of devices. The old gel burned my skin and was overpriced, but this new gel makes my skin feel so plump and basically doubles as a hyaluronic acid serum that doesn't need to be rinsed off and saves me a step.

If this is out of your price range I used to use a collodial silver gel which has a lot of it's own skin benefits. Another budget option that is also easier to get anywhere is aloe vera gel.

step_6.title: NuFace
step_6.description:
If you have the ability to commit to this DAILY, this is my holy grail, the one thing I would take with me to a deserted island. I use the mini, videos on how to use are online.

It works by sending painless microcurrent into your muscles to stimulate collagen production. It does everything it promises, irons out wrinkles, lifts and tones your face, a miracle.

If you feel you don't have time to do this in the am, pm is fine, BUT it does have an instant lifting effect which would be a waste on your pillow.

step_7.title: SPF
step_7.description:
I love the Josie Maran SPF, it is argan oil based though so if your face does not tolerate oil, then find any other SPF that is 30+ to use on a daily basis.

It doesn't matter if it's winter and you don't leave the house, you are being exposed to UV (unless you are also in a windowless room).

I'm also partial to mineral sunscreens because, less chemicals. Another reason I love the Josie Maran one because it doesn't leave that white cast like other mineral sunscreens.

step_8.title: Face Oil
step_8.description: I have a favorite oil, but it's currently not on sale, so I have been using a basic rose-hip oil. Again if your skin does not like oil, you can skip, but depending on why your skin doesn't tolerate oils, there may be an oil for your skin type (for ex: acne prone skin can use jojoba oil). Oil acts as a sealant to work allllll those previous steps in and provide moisture to prevent wrinkles.

step_9.title: Gua Sha
step_9.description: A gua sha stone is a flat piece of jade used for a lymphatic drainage face massage. Jade rollers kind of push things around your face, but the gua sha is to be used in gentle upward and out strokes to your neck/hairline to get fluids and toxins to flush out of your system (great for those who wake up puffy!). You will need some sort of oil to create slip. There are a lot of tutorials online for different skin concerns.

step_10.title: SPF Eye Cream
step_10.description: Many neglect to put SPF on/around their eyes (slash, it burns). So I found a great eye cream with SPF and brightening properties by Supergoop.

step_1.title: Cleanse
step_1.product: La Roche-Posay Toleriane Purifying Foaming Facial Cleanser
step_1.description: Any gentle non-stripping cleanser is good to wash off the day. If you wear make up, make sure to double wash with an oil-based cleanser first then a gentle one. If you feel like you need an exfoliant, find a good gentle one like Tatcha the Deep Cleanse.

step_2.title: Tone
step_2.description: Swipe your face with a cotton pad and toner if you wash your face in the am. I like micellar water or Thayers non-alcoholic toner. No need to if you did not cleanse, skip to step 3.

step_3.title: Mist
step_3.description: Products penetrate better on moist skin plus, it feels so luxurious. Obviously optional but there are a lot of benefits of rose water.

step_4.title: Hyaluronic Acid
step_4.description: HA is a tiny molecule that really penetrates to moisturize your skin, not just sit on top like most moisturizers. It will not feel hydrating, but it is and moisture is the key to preventing wrinkles! I can skip this step in the am thanks to the NuFace Gel.

step_5.title: Actives
step_5.product: Topicals Faded Serum for Dark Spots & Discoloration
step_5.description:
I have been using this serum in the evening for dark spots, though the active ingredients in it are also good for anti-aging. I did have to work my way up to a nightly use just like with most actives.

If you have never used an active like retinol or had bad experiences before, get the smallest concentration and use nightly. If you have any redness/peeling/flaking, go every other night until your skin gets accustomed to it. Then work your way up to stronger concentrations.

Retinol encourages cell turnover so it helps with wrinkles and acne. I use a retinol cream from a derm, if you have a derm I recommend getting retinol Rx because it is cheaper and you know the dosage. If not, The Ordinary has a great variety of retinols to help you ease into it.

step_6.title: Moisturizer
step_6.product: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA Surface Hydration
step_6.description: I'm not too picky with evening moisturizers, as long as it isn't too fragranced and does the job I'm a fan. I tend to switch it up in different seasons and choose something more lightweight in the summer like the Glow Recipe Watermelon Glow Pink Juice Face Moisturizer

step_7.title: Face Oil
step_7.description: I have a favorite oil, but it's currently not on sale, so I have been using a basic rose-hip oil. Again if your skin does not like oil, you can skip, but depending on why your skin doesn't tolerate oils, there may be an oil for your skin type (for ex: acne prone skin can use jojoba oil). Oil acts as a sealant to work allllll those previous steps in and provide moisture to prevent wrinkles.

step_8.title: Gua Sha
step_8.description: A gua sha stone is a flat piece of jade used for a lymphatic drainage face massage. Jade rollers kind of push things around your face, but the gua sha is to be used in gentle upward and out strokes to your neck/hairline to get fluids and toxins to flush out of your system (great for those who wake up puffy!). You will need some sort of oil to create slip. There are a lot of tutorials online for different skin concerns.

step_9.title: Eye Cream
step_9.product: Glow Recipe Avocado Melt Retinol Eye Sleeping Mask
step_9.description: Use any moisturizing eye cream of your choice. If wrinkles/crows feet around the eyes are a concern for you, use a retinol eye cream. I love the retinol eye mask by Glow Recipe.

step_10.title: Sleeping Mask
step_10.description:
Some call this "slugging" which you can do with regular vaseline, but I try to stay away from products with petrolatum. Slugging is when you put a thick mask on your face to help seal in products overnight.

I love Egyptian Magic and recently, Pomada De La Campana (yes it has petrolatum) which has brightening qualities in the zinc.

step_11.title: Lip Mask
step_11.description: Lips get dry from all that mouth breathing overnight, the Laneige lip mask is still moist when I wake up.
